firestore.reasoning:
The data structure is designed to store and retrieve user-submitted ideas efficiently and securely. It leverages a flat collection (`ideas`) to store all ideas, making retrieval simple and scalable.  This design prioritizes ease of querying and displaying ideas for all users, a key requirement of the application. Authorization is not required because any user can read and write to the `ideas` collection.  To fulfill the requirement that all users can view all ideas, there is no user-specific data or nested subcollections. This simplifies the security rules since all documents in the collection have the same access rules.

This structure ensures Authorization Independence since there are no dependencies on data from other documents or collections. It also satisfies the 'Rules are not Filters' (QAPs) principle, as list operations do not require complex filtering based on user roles or permissions.
